title: Nexia app works great!
text:
Our new house came with a Trane XR724 smart thermostat already installed. Scrolling thru the menus showed it had WiFi capability. Cool I thought! I was at first disappointed to find out it only works with a Nexia hub or app, which I had never heard of before. So I installed the app on my iPhone and created an account. Then it came time to get the app and the thermostat to talk to each other. The good news it’s the app takes you step by step thru the process. For security reasons I recommend configuring your router to have a guest WiFi separate (lan access blocked) from your main WiFi and tell the thermostat (via the app) to use the guest WiFi. Once everything is configured, the app talks to the “cloud” and then the “cloud” talks to the thermostat and the thermostat reports back what it’s doing. The thermostat can be fully controlled from anywhere there is an internet connection.

However, I have not been able to get Alexa to work with the Nexia app. The Alexa skill for Nexia is enabled but Alexa says it can’t find the thermostat.

title: 5 stars but do have a strong recommendation for the app developer
text: Suggestion for app developer: I do love the majority of the features over my former thermostat with an app, but there is one feature that I already sorely miss. This would be the ability to manually adjust the temperature different from the schedule running but with a system end time versus running at that temp until the next schedule period which could be hours later. An example for you would be doing vigorous housecleaning that causes a person to get hot such as mopping, dusting and vacuuming where I would previously set the temp for cooler for about an hour duration and then it would automatically revert back to the scheduled temperature at the end of that hour. I have to remember to go back and set back to Run Schedule when done or realize I didn’t when I get too cold when the work is done. Thanks for considering this valuable update.

title: Temp buttons
text: I think we should have the thermostat temperature buttons that are super easy to see and press. The little arrows are just not pleasing to the eye and don’t jump out as “this is how to adjust me” I remember in the past this being easier. As an HVAC dealer I have to say that I love what we can do with this system. I mean how many others can allow the homeowner to give the dealer/technician ability to check everything about the thermostat remotely? Not only can you allow us to control your thermostat temporarily, but we can always check system run stats and make sure your system is working correctly! That alone is very valuable to the homeowner! Maybe the app needs very minor changes but this system is so much more than an app. Must have for everyone.

title: Nice control But could be better
text:
What’s great:  Having internet control from your phone while away from home plus the ability to view run history so you can tell if utility power is out, or your system is down. It does also operate as a hub to run other compatible things such as a camera. 
What’s not: The Nexia thermostat touchscreen is terrible. Most of the time it does not work and you can only make changes using a mobile device or computer. Their is no way to do a temporary hold for a set time such as when you have a party with lots of people the way Honeywell units work. You can only set it on permanent hold and then you must remember to change it back. It takes forever to reboot the thermostat. The hub operation has very limited functionality.
Summary:  Delete the hub. I would much rather have better HVAC operating options, since anyone wanting a hub would purchase a more sophisticated model such as Samsung’s SmartThings to run household equipment. The thermostat application is poor system design with mediocre capability. I will probably change it out to Honeywell.

title: Works well
text: This app is very convenient. I like being able to turn on the heat before getting out of bed in the morning and checking to see if I need to change the setting when going to bed at night. I can turn the heat or air conditioning on, up or down from my recliner. I never touch the thermostat at all. As long as you have internet connection you can control your thermostat from anywhere which I have done so it is cool or warm when I get home.  Its easier to work the thermostat from my phone then actually touching it.

title: As a thermostat control, it’s a train wreck
text:
Update after a year and a rebrand to Trane Home: no change. I spent a fortune on an HVAC system I can barely control (I’m a nerd, I *like* complicated systems, this is just stupid), that frequently says one thing on the app but something different on the wall units, is remarkably slow to accept and act on input, and displays almost zero actionable usage history. 

I’m only using this as a thermostat control, so that’s the extent of this review. In short: it’s a train wreck. Run away. Longer: the interface is ugly. It might update after a while...or it might not. The scheduling conventions were clearly designed by an engineer with little to no UI experience. Did you want data to help you see what effect your changes make on system usage? Ha! No data for you! The most granular it gets is daily - in other words, it’s useless. Seriously, if I had known how bad this was I wouldn’t have spent a fortune on a Trane HVAC system.

title: Expensive thermostat - Nexia app doesn’t live up to it
text:
First, for specific complaints, contact the developer.  I think that’s the only way to get the app working up to the level of what you paid for your “smart device”.

As some others have mentioned, this is not nearly as functional as the app for a Nest or EcoBee.  Those dedicated apps are focused on a single product, whereas the Nexia app is scattershot across a diverse line of products.  The only commonality between the products is the technology employed to allow it to communicate.  Therefore the app lacks focus and control for an advanced item, such as a Trane thermostat.

On the positive side, it does the very basics - change temperature, set schedules, etc.  But for what we paid for the thermostat (or insert your Z-Wave device here), I would expect the app to closely match the presentation and functionality of the thermostat.  Go to your Account on Nexia’s website, and you will see a nice colorful display that resembles what you see on the thermostat.  It doesn’t fully replicate to actual unit, but it comes closer than the app, and is easier on the eyes.

The unit is “smart”.  There are tons of information available on the unit that can be accessed online - why is it not available for the user/owner?  And why does the display have to be so Spartan?

Ask the developers.

title: The app works, surveys are beyond annoying
text:
The app works ok.  There are some bugs, sometimes it gets out of sync and reports temperatures which are inaccurate but that is rate enough to not be a major problem.

The only significant complaint I have about the app is the constant annoying surveys.  They need to make a survey area within the app which doesn’t prevent use of the app, instead when you open the app a survey pops up and prevents use of the app until the survey is closed.  I deducted TWO stars for this.

If the surveys were a once a year thing then I probably wouldn’t even complain but they aren’t, it seems like they have been doing surveys once a month or once every couple of months and I’m sick and tired of them.  I’m to the point that I want to replace the app.

title: The hardest way to program a thermostat I’ve ever see
text:
Having bought 3 new a/c units, we switched to thermostats that work with this app.  Unfortunately, we switched from our Nest thermostats which were amazing.  It is so difficult to program this thermostat, I can’t even say.  It was far easier when I had just a digital thermostat with no app at all!!! And it would be awesome if I could copy one program to another thermostat.  But no.  Why can’t I change the time when I open up a particular time period?  Nope.  Only the temp or, bizarrely, the name of the period.  I tried, my husband tried, and our teen tried.  I ended up paying her $50 to sit with it for a LONG time and try to make it work.  

I give it 2 stars only because it’s easy to change the current temp from my phone.  In my opinion, that’s all the app has going doe it.

title: It does the minimum.
text:
It does what it’s supposed to do, at least so far. That’s the best thing I can say about it. Has much less data available than the wall panel, which is frustrating. 

UX looks like it was designed by an engineer. If they were trying to make a confusing app with difficult navigation then they succeeded. (I have one thermostat device. Why are there two different settings screens in the app? Thermostat and other device settings should be a sub-item on the main settings navigation controller. Or just call one App Settings so it’s clear they’re different.) Nexia badly needs an actual UX designer, or to even just look at Nest app for ideas on how to make it less bare and ugly. 

That said, we no choice in the matter. We had to get a completely new HVAC system and the variable speed system we wanted was incompatible with Nest. It is what it is. Our big thing was to be able to tweak the temp without going downstairs and we can. But overall, Nest app was a fantastically better user experience, Nexia is definitely not an improvement. 

Hopefully devs are reading reviews and take this as constructive, I’m not trying to be brutal, just honest. The app does what it needs to do, but UX could seriously use some love.

title: Current inside temperature doesn’t show the right temp
text: The current inside temperature shows wrong a lot of the time.  It will be working great and then all of a sudden it will show 2-4 degrees off.  The dealer who installed it came out and adjusted in in the settings for it to start working right and I have to go in and readjust the settings.  I shouldn’t have to do that ever.  I have to turn the heat down to a lower setting for it to be the right temperature in our home.  Last week it was working right and then all of a sudden it had run most of the day because the temp was off again.  So it was 70 in our house instead of around 66.  Last night it showed 66 and then all of a sudden 70 which was right temperature (in the room) and then back down to 65 all in a ten minute time span.  I had it set on 65.

title: Zone controls difficult to control
text: We just got the Platinum system installed in our home and while it was very expensive it is not user friendly.  I walked into a secondary bedroom to find the heater blowing when it was 8 degrees warmer than the set temperature. I could find no off button so I went online to try to figure out how to turn it off. There was no off button there either. I finally adjusted the temperature to even colder and it finally shut off.   Also at 50% setting for the fan it sounds like a wind storm in the room. I figured out how to reduce that after pouring through the installation manual since the information was not in the user manual.  Maybe my problems have to do with the installers who struggled with setting up the system too. Either way I am not happy with the new system.

title: Miserable
text:
Takes forever to load, make changes, sync, etc. If you want to change your schedule, it will literally take anywhere between 2-10 minutes depending on how frequently it times out. Do NOT exit the App while it’s making said change. That’ll just start the process over. I’ve been putting up with this for 6 years. The silver lining of replacing one of our thermostats was converting to Ecobee app. I still have to use this for the other thermostat and re-load the schedule EVERY time our power glitches. In 6 years, I’ve had to do it maybe 50 times. That’s 50 pain-staking times. 
On the Upside, the schedule for the outdoor light-switch is Amazingly reliable. Complete contrast. I set it 6 years ago and haven’t had to touch it since. I’d give 5 stars on that part for sure..

title: Absolutely Awesome
text:
If anyone is on the fence about a variable speed train compressor, don’t be.
My wife and I are so impressed with what the system can do and how it balances the temperature within our home in a way that no on and off single stage unit can do. It is amazing how it operates at variable speeds not only the compressor but the air blower as they talk to each other.
It creates such an even temperature no hot and cold spots. 
Also I would like to mention the incredible smart Wi-Fi thermostat that allows us to see everything as it is happening and look back on previous events. Percentage of compressor being used, percentage of air blower being used, outdoor temperature, indoor temperature, indoor humidity. 
We can see everything and control everything from our phone with the Nexia App. 
We are very impressed with the performance and the ability of the Trane variable speed heat pump with ComfortLink II XL 1050 WiFi touch screen smart thermostat and Nexia platform.

title: Decent App
text:
The Nexia Trane Home app works pretty well. Easy monitoring and allows easy adjustments to your thermostat via WiFi. 

I really wish it had an integrated Apple Watch app as well. Our old Ecobee had that and it was perfect. Could easily make adjustments from the Apple Watch…especially if waking up at night and not wanting to blind yourself with your phone or iPad. Unfortunately the Ecobee didn’t communicate well with our Trane system so had to switch to the Trane Thermostat. 

Consider adding Apple Watch app in the next update!!

title: Trane A/C
text:
I have this app paired with a Trane A/C. All of the functions are available as long as you go through the settings. Only the temperature setting is on the home screen. The home screen is very basic. Things like geofencing is available as well as an allergy setting if you opted for the air cleaner. Many more settings are available but not in a user friendly format. So far, I think the app is great, put an upgraded home screen with some options and I would give it 5 stars.

Every time it pops up to ask if I’m enjoying a Nexia, I will lower the rating by 1 star. I just want to use the app, leave me alone.

title: Forced to use this after installing new Trane
text: Have been a nest user for years and had to move to this app due to the required installation of a XL1050 thermostat which is supposedly “top of the line” doesn’t even sense motion...ok. Have to use the Nexia app with this thermostat. Who is Nexia? Never heard of them and now I know why. Upon downloading the app saw the bad reviews and thought that’s a sign of things to come.  This app can’t even give you the correct temperature all the time from the thermostat. Sometimes accurate, sometimes off by a degree that’s hilarious. As others have said the interface isn’t good. Scheduling is abysmal. I guess it’s about as basic as you can get since you can change the temp in the app. Don’t even get me started if you try to add a device here comes another beg for a subscription.

title: Settings are optional
text: When I first got the system every worked perfectly, if I set it on 72 in summer (because is cold enough tanks to the insulation in the house) it will stay there and all was great. Bills haven been half of what I payed before the upgrade. But it all got complicated when I went online and set up the “schedule for work and weekends”. Doesn’t matter what I did I can’t get it to change the settings. Doesn’t matter what I try to keep a temperature setting with out this thing going back to scheduled mode. I event have it on permanent hold. The app and the actual thermostat need some major updates, because I can not believe that having an app that clearly changes the setting can not hold or override changes made online in a pc.

title: Very Functional
text: The Nexia thermostat is very accurate and functional. We turn our temperature up or down when we are away on trips for several days. On the journey home we reset the temperature to our preferred temperature so when we arrive the house is cool or warm. I can do this easily from my iPhone. I like the display functionality as well. You can change the screen colors to your preferences or to match your decor. There are many easy to use settings as well. Very happy with the thermostat and Nexia.

title: Geofences don’t work half the time!
text: Geofences aren’t reliable. I leave the house, outside of my ¾ mile radius and it works, moves both thermostat up to 82°. I come home, entering my ¾ mile radius and sometimes my Run 78° Automation works and other times not. I walk in the house and thermostats are still set at 82° and the Nexia app here on my iPhone shows no occupants within the geofence! Force quit the app, turn on and turn off airplane mode and restart the app, and nothing. Same thing. App still says no occupants in the geofence and I do see the location arrow popping up in the status bar that my location was accessed when opening the Nexia app. Not reliable and I manually have to force the Automation when I get home. Annoying when you have features that don’t work half the time!

title: Most non-intuitive app ever
text: I was about to replace my old Honeywell smart thermostat with a Nest when it became evident that I had to replace my entire HVAC system.  Chose Trane at the recommendation of the company that sold me my previous system.  Both AC an furnace are nice units and functioning as expected.  Unfortunately, the Nest is incompatible with the Trane so I had to go with their thermostat and app.  I think there is a lot of capability here but, and I consider myself fairly tech savvy, can’t figure out how to do it.  Cold weather has arrived here in Seattle and I simply want to have the heat at 70 during the day an 67 at night.  Should be easy; it was with the Honeywell and probably was with the Nest but I have no clue how to do it with the Trane.  Tomorrow I’ll test their tech support.

title: How does anyone even remotely like this app?
text:
Rule No. 1 when creating apps should be “Don’t Make The User Think.” The good ones do that. This ones doesn’t even come close.

Compared to the Honeywell app I used to have, this app is ridiculously user-unfriendly. I have to think way too much to do the most basic things, so I basically hate it. I gave it two stars because I can use it as a remote control and figure that’s worth something. But creating a heating/cooling schedule via this app is far more trouble than it needs to be. 

In addition to that, the interface is downright UGLY. This is the most poorly visually designed app I have. I even bought another company’s thermostat so I wouldn’t have to use this app. Unfortunately, those nice non-Nexia thermostats would not work with my HVAC system and I had to put the Trane thermostat back, so I’m stuck with this stupid, ugly app that gives me headache every time I use it.

How anyone has given this more than two stars, which is already too generous, is beyond me.

title: One thing needs changing!
text: When you click on your individual unit that you want to adjust, user needs to be able to swipe back out of that! You have to push this tiny arrow in the top left corner the size of a pixel and it is directly next to the unit name’s edit button. Ever single time I hit the name edit button and get annoyed. Maybe I have abnormally large thumbs, but it seems like a no brained to be able to swipe back to main unit selection page. That’s it. Otherwise I find it easy to use.

title: Dealer and User of Nexia
text: Our company installed Trane Equipment, all of our systems installed come with a Nexia thermostat, we help the client setup the user friendly app which then allows several home automation devices to sync up with the convenience of this one Nexia App.  As a dealer, I use the product to assist with setup and troubleshooting from my office saving users and my company time and money.   Keep up the good work Nexia!  Also I must say their customer service and technical support are the best in the industry!

title: Either remote or from the couch you have control.
text: I’ve enjoyed Nexia products for many years. I used to be a Trans sales rep. For an independent distributor. At that time I had a full line of cameras locks and a Trane zone system. After retiring I installed a new Trane system and made sure it included a communicating thermostat so I could use the Nexia program to control both heating and cooling. I totally appreciate remote control from home or while on vacation.

title: Easy and reliable!
text: I installed the Nexia system in a vacation home about a year ago and while I was concerned with the property management being so far away the Nexia remote App has been fantastic.  I monitor the climate remotely as well as installed a water sensor to insure there are no leaks that can surprise me upon my visits.  Overall the system has been working wonderfully and gives me a piece of mind knowing the property is ok in my absence.   I highly recommend Nexia.

title: Slow and Unresponsive and Weird Nanny-Control
text:
First: the app UX is slow, like A noticeable amount of time from pressing a button to seeing it register.  
Second: (A) often there is a connection failure from the app to the thermostats
(B) Within the app I tried about 5 times to set a schedule but there was always an error or just didnt save the schedule. Had to use the computer browser interface to set it.

Thirdly: Necia does not allow for the user to set cooling temperature and warming temperature less than 4 degrees apart because, the app states, it could cause the system to switch between cooling and warming rapidly. The obvious solution is to let the user select which temperature control function is enabled like Honeywell smart thermostats let.  I and a lot of men like me dont like nanny-like restrictions on our $30K A/C equipment.

So to some it up, and while trying not to be inflammatory, have Americans design the UX and always always: Know Your Audience ;-) Seriously.

title: Love it!
text: I can set the temperature from my bed if I think it’s to hot or cold in the house. I can adjust the temperature when I am away for several hours and reset when I’m close to home. I’m new to Nexia but in the future I’ll be able to compare operating costs! I also have preprogrammed temperatures, What’s not to love? Bassett Services installed my new furnace/air conditioner/and Nexia they can also monitor the system at my home. How good is that!!!

title: Arguably the least features of any modern app
text:
Considering my we case to use this app is that I was forced to use it for the thermostat that controls our new variable speed Trane ac system - I expected a modern day app with some useful features. You can basically set the temp and sometime even that takes a few tries! All other useful info is either not present or so far out of sync it’s misleading as to what the system is really doing. 

Compared to my ecobee and it’s app this is an embarrassment for both Trane and ingressoll who developed this platform - I would not reccomend Trane variable speed units purely because of this app and would have likely Gabe two speed had I known how much of a step backwards this would be.

title: Not specifically for this app, but...
text:
When their system goes down the app is of course affected. This really is annoying as it seems there is nothing posted on any media site notifying users of their outages. You may get lucky and see a message when you open the app, but for example today. The entire system webpage and all is offline. Yet nothing is letting me know this is the case. Not twitter not facebook. Not their main homepage. 

I sure hope they don’t just completely take off during the weekend with no one watching the business function.

title: Temp sensing
text:
I probably don’t have as many needs as other. Being able to just change temperatures remotely and view temperatures is all I need. Changing temps is easy but the sensing or collecting of temp data is always off. It is always detecting higher that what is reality. Not a huge deal if the difference is always the same. I can math. The app also shows if the system is cooling/heating or idle. Would be nice to see compressor speed.

Edit: Lower rating. It gives me all I need when it stays connected to main thermostat. I’m finding it disconnected more than connect, which is funny considering my remote thermostat unit has dropped yet.

title: 4 years now - came with Lennar home.
text: I would have to say for the last 4 years in our new home - I would give it 4 stars. My only concern is when internet goes down - so do the cameras and door alerts. Can not use the app from another location. Also, I have called customer service approx 4 times and every time they have been above par! No phone trees/ fast curtious service - very smart and professional!

title: Good while it lasted
text:
Thermostat was installed 8 months ago and no longer senses current temperature. Installer says he has 5 ready to go back to Nexia. I liked the app, but with hardware quality so low I won’t buy another Nexia product

Update: I had set up an appointment to replace my thermostat but was notified by Nexia that I needed to reboot thermostat after they remotely messed with it. Thermostat seemed to work normally for two days but then started doing the same thing. It can’t sense current temperature to shut off either calling for heat or cooling causing excessive hot or cold beyond thermostat settings. Really not a thermostat at all since they apparently did something to it as part of some update to the firmware.

title: Not Impressed
text: This is only the second day I’ve been using this app and while I’m still in a learning mode, I can honestly say it’s convenient because I can change the temperature but that’s about it. The UI “Dashboard” is nothing but a black box with up and down arrows with the numerical temperature displayed between them. Zero colors except for gray. Looks nothing like what’s pictured in the App Store. I’m able to see events, but no schedule or anything else. Hey support, if there’s something I’m missing, please let me know.

title: App Works OK | Not a Nest | Apple Compatibility Issues
text:
We had a Nest smart thermostat for years, snd replaced it with the Trane when we added air conditioning to our home in Seattle. 

App is a bit clunky in setting up schedules, but it works. No where near as easy to configure as Nest. The good news is Trane does not data harvest and sell information like Google does since they bought Nest. 

Looks like the engineers at Trane do not like Apple. Cannot get Siri to work with the unit, and they say they have no plans to make it compatible with Home Kit.

title: So-so
text:
This app is convenient. You can set and adjust the temperature from anywhere. The history feature is nice but doesn’t add any real value.

The big drawback is the poor temperature control. I usually keep the house cooler during the daytime and warmer in the evening. But after the temperature set point changes it will heat until the temperature rises a couple of degrees then turn off. The mode doesn’t matter, it works that way in all modes. 

I really wish I had stayed with the Honeywell thermostat.

title: Five stars but I have a suggestion for the documentation
text: When the app is first set up or a new mobile device is registered, a new geofence has to be set up. The documentation should mention that the app will say that your mobile device is not within the geofence until the device physically exits and re-enters the geofence. It would save a lot of frustration.

title: Nice app
text: The Nexia app makes setting and monitoring my thermostats extremely easy.  I really like the runtime history feature which allows yo to monitor the systems run times (heating and cooling) for a week.  I find myself using the app to adjust my settings rather than using the thermostat itself.  It’s nice to be able to adjust the upstairs unit without having to climb the stairs.

title: When will the app be available for the Apple Watch?
text:
I was wondering when will the app be available for Apple Watch?  My watch is always handy and sometimes easier to use than the phone—depending on circumstances. 
The app on the phone and the online version for my MacBook usually work fine. The online site takes getting used to and adding a new schedule takes a bit to work out. 
But it is dependable and I like being able to control my home’s environment through it.

title: Homes with outdoor wood boiler.
text: I have an outdoor wood boiler. It it was we use to heat our home. I have a hydronic coil with hot water circulation from outdoor to indoor. It’s a very efficient heat but with an American standard thermostat I can only run our thermostat in the off position. And the automations turn off and sometimes do not work as precisely as needed. Can you guys get back to me and maybe there is a small upgrade or automation change than can be made to better control my fan in my furnace! Thank you!

title: Nice useful app
text: I haven’t gotten into some of the more advanced features yet, but this app is fantastic for adjusting the thermostat when you’re home, and especially when you are not. Easy to read and easy to understand. The Trane thermostat came with my new house. Thought I would be switching it to a Google nest. Nope. I like this set up. You will too.

title: Happy customer
text:
I got a new cell phone and wanted to use it to control my thermostat. I was unable to accomplish the task. I sent an email to Nexia and received a reply shortly with the instructions, which was very easy to understand. Within 1 minute I had the new phone controlling the thermostat. 
Even though I never talked to an individual, the person that answered my email was extremely courteous. 
Thanks to Nexia.

title: Unhappy With Communication
text: I keep having major issues with WiFi connection cutting off and not being able to connect with the thermostat from remote. I already informed the dealer and asked for a new thermostat but no reply. I am frustrated with the remote connection and contrail capabilities of this system considering the high cost.

title: Multiple nodes not shown
text: I have it a three bc it is missing a KEY feature. We have two thermostats and each has its own node (an extension to report the temp in that area where it is placed). So each thermostat is only capable of connecting to one node. Unlike Nest. I digress. But the app only lets us see the two thermostats but one node. Sooooo app Devs when can we get this fixed bc we would like to be able to know the temp in that area . This is why we bought the node. Thanks.

title: Nexia
text: We just had a new HVAC system installed in our fixer upper. The thermostat has an app which is awesome! We don’t live here permanently yet, so when we are in our other home in a different state we can turn up or turn down the air-conditioning!!  Sometimes you forget to do it when you leave. Or it may be too hot and workers come so you can adjust it do they are comfortable!  Love this!

title: Simple & easy to use
text: Love this App;  simple and easy to use.  Has all the features I need.  My house is in southern Arizona and this App allows me to monitor the temperature inside my house while I’m away.  When I’m on my way home from a trip, I can adjust the temperature hours before I get home.  It’s been great!!!  Please don’t change this App!!!

title: Thermostat
text: Just got started with the app but am pleased so far. Just wish that I could zero in my location as the zip using a general location which is located 30 plus miles to the north of where I’m actually located. Temp is usually way warmer where I’m at which can throw things off but still a cool app to have.

title: Doesn’t allow to change temp or other functions through the app
text: This app isn’t working. It always says ‘Not Connected’ even though I verified before leaving the house that the internet was connected and working on the thermostat. It shows me how the thermostat is functioning and the temperature but doesn’t let me change the temperature or any settings, so seems pretty useless. Also, there’s no option like my other thermostat app to uninstall/delete the thermostat and reconnect it (over all the app is not easy to navigate).

title: Love the ease, one suggestion
text:
I love how easy it is to change programming.  I love how the grouping is easy.

I really wish you could schedule a thermostat to a certain program on certain days of the MONTH and the rest of the days it runs the normal program.  Like if I could click certain dates on the calendar and program the thermostat for those dates. But the rest of the days run another program.

title: App stay in sync
text:
I have been using Nexia for a while and I have just been working on a wink and SmartThings Hub, Their apps are horrific they look awful but one thing they both are great at was staying in sync with the devices. Every time I login the app I will see
Devices not reporting the correct status and still dont after a refresh. 
Is there something different between what they do and what you guys do?

title: Convenient and Easy
text: The Nexia thermostat app is convenient and easy to use.  I like being able to set or change schedules or temperature settings in my home without having to get up out of my chair or even having to be home. This is especially nice when I’m out of town. I think it’s a great app.

title: Terrific!
text:

This app is not intuitive! On top of that, there are no help files and no way to try and figure out a problem yourself! The support is top notch but who wants to email them for every single thing that we can't figure out?

After trying to find an answer over a 4 day period, I emailed them. I got a prompt reply telling me that I had to sign in with my husband's account!

I've just spent another hour trying (unsuccessfully) to set up a schedule! I've finally figured out how to do much of it but there's no explanation as to why Saturday and Sunday can't have a second time added (it's simply from 8am to 8am), nor why, when I adjust Monday it asks if I want to apply the settings to Saturday and Sunday, but not the rest of the week! But when I adjust Saturday it offers to apply the setting to M-F but not Sunday! And don't get me started on the frustration of setting a day's "cool" temperature, then trying to set the "heat" temperature - but if you change the heat a degree or more then what THEY chose, THEY change your "cool" temperature with it!

I'm REALLY wishing I had a choice on which app to use with our new furnace/AC unit! I definitely wouldn't choose this one!!!

title: Used to Work.... But, just stopped working....
text:
I have used the Nexia system and app for years. The Alerts feature was one of the most useful features for us. However, that feature quit working completely, including the disappearance of all alerts history. When I accessed the app to determine why I wasn’t receiving alerts anymore, there was a message indicating there were no alerts set for our home and instructions to click the settings button above to set up alerts. When I clicked the settings button, it showed at least 10 different settings that were set up. Despite them being set up already, I hit Save and was returned to the Alerts screen where I was advised, once again, there were no alerts set up for our home. 

Contact with Support via email provided no help. 2 days after sending my email requesting assistance, I received an email advising me to call them during specific hours and days. So I call during a specified time and day, negotiate the automated system prompts, finally reach a Support person, and am told to delete and re-add, then reactivate, my phone in the Nexia system. This not only doesn’t fix the issue, but now Alerts are not even available among my dashboard menu.....  So, I am advised to delete and reinstall the app completely on my phone. Same result, not fixed and Alerts no longer visible at all. 
Support then advises they need to escalate the issue, they will have to email their support (that’s right, Support’s Support person), but nobody is there at that time to provide them an answer. Why would you instruct your customer to call during a time when ALL levels of support are not available to actually solve a problem???
So, after a half hour of wasted time with “Support”, I’m no better than before and Alerts aren’t even visible anymore. 
And I pay an annual fee for this.....??  Probably not much longer....
There are better systems out there now. I guess it’s time to explore those better choices. 
Very disappointing performance and customer service to say the least.....

text:
New variable furnace and AC which is "too smart" for my old Nest (which can only handle 1- and 2-stage). 

Nexia needs:
1) ability to adjust schedule on phone. Currently,  can only be done by walking to wall device. 

2) ability to toggle FAN from 0-100%. Currently,  can only be done by walking to wall device.  (Note: I am not referring to compressor which is and should remain automatic)

3) ability to schedule FAN. Ideally, I might want fan (again, not the compressor or furnace but the FAN which circulates Air) to run a schedule of 80% during day and then perhaps a quieter mode, 35%, at night.  Something like that.  Currently,  can only be done by walking to wall device.  I manually turn fan up or down. 

 4) the Usage app...needs to get out of Beta and provide legit information.  How about eye candy line chart showing compressor percent by hour? 

None of this should be rocket science. The ability to do most of this exists on the panel already. 

At the very least...just copy Nest. At the best, please add essential functionality beyond a competitor. 

As it is, once Nest comes out with a variable controller, then this controller and app are going in the trash.

This app could go from being the bare minimum to a selling point for Trane HVAC products if a few things were done:
- Optimize for iPhone X and update for this stuff faster in the future. This is why Apple releases Betas; dev/test early. 
- Add HomeKit. Apple is releasing HomeKit2 soon which isn’t going to require a special chip. Adding HomeKit would really differentiate because TRANE would have the only variable heat pumps with HomeKit compatibility. Apple users want this. 
- Publish an API to the Nexia site so that developers can more easily integrate hubs with Nexia. SmartThings, Control4, Savant, Crestron, Harmony, SimpleControl, etc. Nexia only benefits from partnering.

title: Worst App Ever!!!
text: Wish you could select zero stars! It is sad that you spend so much on an American Standard AC system and are forced to use this app with their custom thermostat. At least 80% of the time the app shows disconnected yet when I go upstairs the thermostat says connected to the internet. And it the app is connected it takes 5-6 times of changing the temperature for it to actually take. Sometimes I give up and just go upstairs and change it manually.  American Standard should partner with Nest, their app puts Nexia to absolute shame! I wish there was another app that worked with these thermostats!

title: Please don't sign up for Nexia service
text: I am trying to save you and your household a lot of hassle. Nexia's service is not worth even the $10 or so dollars they charge every month. Their app NEVER communicates properly with front door lock devices and almost always requires logging into a computer to do basic and simple tasks like setting user codes and such. They are not somewhere you want to go for home automation or any of their other services. Their customer service is terribly shoddy and I am so frustrated right now that I feel I owe it to the next person to save you the headache.
